comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Considering the backdrop, this is obviously not the actual statue (while it was) on top of the arch.  It says "cast", so I wonder if there was a replica somewhere since no one could really see the statue without climbing the maintenance ladder?

comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: According to this site, the statue is titled "Columbus" (not to be confused with the Columbus in front of the Administration Building), and by Daniel C French. A page on the Illinois Institue of Technology site also gives credit to Edward Clark Potter. The two worked on other pieces together, such as the Statue of the Republic, Cart Horse Group, and Statue of the Bull
